content.raw:
It would be pretty straightforward to define two interface classes: one for modifying systems and one for non-modifying systems. Then the plugin loader can be used to inspect which interface is provided by any given system. If both interfaces are provided, then maybe query the system in both phases.

That would allow the systems to express what type of system they are, and we don’t need to worry about dangling no-op virtual functions.

Edit: Note that each of the interface classes could virtually inherit the base `System` class, so all Systems would have the same `Init(~)` function, whether they’re a modifying system or a non-modifying system.
